Job Title: Lead Mechanical Engineer

Location: United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
*Lead Mechanical Engineer*

Salary: $100,000 â€“ $150,000 annual

The position can be housed out of a number of plants across the country, ideally in Columbus, OH where the company is headquartered. Relocation assistance is available. Sponsorship for immigration cases is unavailable. Must be able to meet travel requirement of up to 70% to company plants, primarily located in USA, and Canada.

Summary

The Engineering Lead is responsible for successfully implementing/supporting/managing various manufacturing platforms used for production in domestic and international locations. The Engineering Lead acts as the team lead for implementing projects.

Primary Job Responsibilities

 Successfully coordinate and schedule team members who are supporting various equipment projects, facility projects, and continuous improvement efforts. Participate in emergency troubleshooting to expedite the plant's return to production. Lead sourcing and installation of critical plant support equipment (chillers, compressors, towers, vacuum pumps, grinders, and electrical infrastructure). Provide leadership support for equipment installations. Participate and lead in Root Cause Analysis (RCA) problem solving and Continuous Improvement Kaizen events. Work with the plant teams to predict, plan, and execute field rebuilds of worn equipment. Define and execute plant support projects to satisfy internal customers (Plant Managers).

*Job Skills*

 Plastic extrusion or injection mold experience. Strong project management skills. Strong mechanical and electrical troubleshooting aptitude. Work autonomously and with minimal supervision. Ability to analyze risks and develop mitigation reports. Familiarity with lean processes and continuous improvement tools. Strong verbal and written communication. Proficient in AutoCAD. Ability to work within a team environment.

Educational Requirements

 Bachelor's Degree in Engineering Preferred 2-4 years Associates or Bachelor's Degree in Mechanical, Electrical, or Plastics acceptable with experience. Equivalent experience Multilingual (preferred)

Preferred Experience

 Read and write fluently in English and Spanish, as needed At least five years in a manufacturing environment In addition to strong mechanical knowledge and experience, electrical or mechatronics is a plus.

Physical Requirements

 Ability to lift up to 50 lbs. Work within the plant climate conditions Position requires a full range of body motion - including twisting, bending, reaching, squatting, and the ability to mount/dismount industrial equipment and vehicle Work safely in and around plant equipment Ability to perform physical labor for extended periods in temperature extremes Ability to stand and be mobile for a minimum of 8 continuous hours Meet travel requirement of up to 60%-70% to company plants, primarily located in USA, and Canada.

INDS

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $100,000.00 - $150,000.00 per year

Benefits

 401(k) 401(k) matching Dental insurance Employee assistance program Health insurance Life insurance Paid time off Parental leave Professional development assistance Relocation assistance Retirement plan Vision insurance

Experience Level

 3 years

Schedule

 Day shift Monday to Friday

Application Question(s)

 Are you willing and able to meet the potential 60%-70% travel requirement? Travel is typically within the continental 48 states and, on rare occasions, Canada. Travel is helping to oversee urgent plant projects and respond to escalated mechanical issues. Duration is usually few days or a week, up to two weeks. There may be opportunities to come home on weekends, though from an expense perspective, it's preferred if someone can often stay in the traveled area for the duration. The primary focus of this role is to serve as an escalation leader to solve/troubleshoot mechanical related equipment issues. While CAD drawing/design is a great skill - this is much more of hands-on role with the equipment and providing direction to other engineers/millwrights. Do you have experience troubleshooting or maintaining industrial equipment? Plastics extrusion experience is a highly desired. Have you managed or led capital projects? If yes, what kind of industry or project(s) did it entail? Will you now, or in the future, require sponsorship for immigration cases?

Work Location: On the road

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
